Package com.Handin

Class ApplianceBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.Handin.Appliance
      • com.Handin.ApplianceBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CyclicFixed, CyclicVaries, RandomFixed, RandomVaries
    public class ApplianceBuilder
extends Appliance
    ApplianceBuilder is a class which extends the abstract appliance class. This is a template for an appliance read from the config file.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.Handin.Appliance

        cycleLength, fixedUnits, maxUnits, minUnits, probability, subclass

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApplianceBuilder

        public ApplianceBuilder​(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String subclass,
                        java.lang.String meter,
                        double minUnits,
                        double maxUnits,
                        double fixedUnits,
                        int probability,
                        int cycleLength)
        Constructor initialises the properties of an appliance stored as a string at first before being built in the housebuilder class
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the appliance (e.g: Cooker)
        subclass - Type of appliance (e.g: RandomVaries)
        meter - Meter which records its consumption and production (e.g: Electric)
        minUnits - Minimum amount of units an appliance uses if applicable (Varies)
        maxUnits - Maximum amount of units an appliance uses if applicable (Varies)
        fixedUnits - Fixed amount of units an appliance uses if applicable
        probability - Probability the appliance will run if a Random type of appliance
        cycleLength - The amount of time an appliance will run for if a Cyclic type of appliance
        See Also:
        HouseBuilder

      • timePasses

        public void timePasses()
        Description copied from class: Appliance
        'timePasses' is an abstract method which simulates one hour passing by in the simulation. The appliance subclasses have their own implementations which represents how they use utilities.
        Specified by:
        timePasses in class Appliance
